item.title: Reconnaissance
item.description: Reconnaissance (MITRE Tactic TA0043) is discovering and collecting information on the system and the victim. The reconnaissance phase is the planning phase for the adversaries.

item.title: SIEM
item.description: What is SIEM? SIEM is a security solution that combines security information and event management, which involves real-time logging of events in an environment ...

item.title: SOAR
item.description: SOAR (Security Orchestration Automation and Response) SOAR stands for Security Orchestration Automation and Response. It enables security products and tools in an environment to work together, streamlining the tasks of SOC team members.

item.title: SOC
item.description: What is SOC? Security Operations Center (SOC) is a team of IT security professionals tasked with monitoring, preventing , detecting , investigating, and responding to threats within ...

item.title: Timestomping
item.description: Timestomping is a technique that modifies the timestamps of a file (the modify, access, create, and change times), often to mimic files that are in the same folder and blend malicious ...

item.title: Unified Kill Chain
item.description: The unified kill chain aims to complement (not compete with) other cybersecurity kill chain frameworks, such as The Cyber Kill Chain. It states that there are 18 phases to an attack: Everything from Reconnaissance to data exfiltration and understanding an attackerâ€™s motive.

item.title: Watering Hole
item.description: A watering hole attack is a targeted attack designed to aim at a specific group of people by compromising the website they are usually visiting and then redirecting them to the malicious ...

item.title: Wireshark
item.description: Tool used to analyze network traffic. The GOAT.

item.title: fuzzy hashing
item.description: Fuzzy hashing helps us to perform similarity analysis - match two files with minor differences based on the fuzzy hash values. One of the examples of fuzzy hashing is the usage of SSDeep.
